thread.title: Chinese billionaire granted bail in UN bribery scheme case
thread.title_full: Chinese billionaire granted bail in UN bribery scheme case - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Chinese billionaire granted bail in UN bribery scheme case
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - Over a prosecutor's objections, a federal magistrate judge in New York says a Chinese billionaire at the center of a bribery case involving the United Nations can be released on bail.
U.S. Magistrate Judge Kevin Nathaniel Fox set bail for Ng Lap Seng (eeng-lap-sing) at $50 million, including $20 million cash. He will stay at a luxury Manhattan apartment.
Fox says Ng must wear an electronic bracelet and pay the $200-an-hour cost of two private security guards who will ensure he reports to court as required.
Ng has been charged in a bribery conspiracy with five others, including a former president of the U.N. General Assembly.
A prosecutor says Ng has every reason to flee. Defense lawyer Benjamin Brafman says Ng wants to clear his name.
